intro: Dipcadi thollonianum, commonly known as the Thollonian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its bulbs are an important food source for certain local wildlife, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
